owl:Ontology.terms:description: The HDGI ontology aims to model the pose and/or movement of human upper limbs that are used to interact with devices (particularly with device affordances). It is mapped around gestures performed by human's upper limb region to interact with these affordances. While allowing these mapping the ontology is also developed to be used as a dictionary for manufacturers, designers and developer community to browse and locate commonly used gestures to command certain affordances, or/and to understand the connections and dynamics around it. This ontology is made accessible, flexible and extendable enabling device manufacturers, designers and users to incorporate new gestures and map the relations to corresponding affordances accordingly. The ontology is geared at mapping the ubiquitousness in gesture vocabularies by linking them appropriately and does not enforce designers and manufacturers to follow a standard.
owl:Ontology.terms:rights: Copyright Â© 2020 Madhawa Perera, Armin Haller
owl:Ontology.terms:title: Human Device Gesture Interaction Ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: Human Device Gesture Interaction Ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation from a Affordance to a Device describing the affordances of a device.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: affordedBy

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation from a Human to a User Context or from a Device to a Device Context.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasContext

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers and i-component = x
In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: i-component

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers j-component = y
In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: j-component

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers k-component = z
In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: k-component

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Frame of reference or the initial center. Location of the (0,0,0) postion related to the given coordinates.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: originPoint

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Represents the amount of rotation which will occur about this axis defined by (i-component, j-component, k-component). Known as scalar component.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: w-component

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Affordances are all the type of properties that belong to devices. They indicate the possible actions users can take with it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Affordance

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Human body. A collection of body parts.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Body

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A device denotes a piece of hardware or software which consists of sensors or actuators or both.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A finger is a body part of the human body and a type of digit.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Finger
owl:Class.skos:example: thumb, middle finger, left ring finger etc

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The forearm is the line between the elbow joint and the wrist.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Forearm

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A gesture is a movement or a pose of the fingers and/or palm and/or upper arm and/or forearm.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gesture

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Gestures (movements) made with fingers and palms
owl:Class.rdfs:label: HandGesture

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Second finger or the second digit of hand.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: IndexFinger

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Fifth finger or the fifth digit of hand.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LittleFinger

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The local coordinate system is the coordinate system that is convenient for a given entity (Finger, palm etc.), local space, or object space.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LocalCoordinateSystem

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Third finger or the third digit of hand.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: MiddleFinger

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The act of moving a certain body part towards a certain direction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Movement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The area located at the end of the forearm (starting from wrist) up until the start of a finger which is the central region of the anterior part of the hand.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Palm

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Movement of palm. Either right or left.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PalmMovement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Position of a pose in a particular time
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Position

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A quaternion is defined as q = w + xi + yj + zk where w, x, y, and z are real numbers and i is defined as square root of -1. With quaternions, i = j = k = square root of -1.
The magnitude of a quaternion is calculated by magnitude = square root of (w2 + x2 + y2 + z2). For the unit quaternions, the magnitude is one.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Quaternion

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Fourth finger or the fourth digit of hand.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RingFinger

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The upper arm is the line between the shoulder and elbow joint.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: UpperArm
